metadata.narrative: Phoenix Rivals edged out the Coastal Kings with a late defensive press that forced turnovers in the final three minutes.

playerBios.name: Jordan Ellis
playerBios.playingStyle: Floor general with high pick-and-roll volume and midrange pull-ups.
playerBios.seasonNotes: Focused on tempo control and limiting turnovers after offseason core-strength program.

playerBios.name: Maya Santos
playerBios.playingStyle: Off-ball movement shooter with 41% from deep this month.
playerBios.seasonNotes: Emphasis on catch-and-shoot triples from weak-side flare actions.

playerBios.name: Isaac Long
playerBios.playingStyle: Rim protector who anchors the drop coverage. Efficient in short-roll playmaking.
playerBios.seasonNotes: Working on switching angles to contain quick guards.

coachStrategies.name: Arjun Patel
coachStrategies.gamePlan: Control pace with early drag screens, punish Kings' weak side rotations with hammer sets.
adjustments: Increased weak-side stunts at Kings' stretch four after early hot shooting.
Extended defensive pressure to three-quarter court after timeout at 6:14 Q4.

coachStrategies.name: Lena Cho
coachStrategies.gamePlan: Blend drop coverage with selective switches to disrupt dribble handoffs.
adjustments: Called for nail help tags on Kings' guard attacks in the 3rd quarter.
Deployed matchup zone for two possessions to protect Santos from foul trouble.

events.description: Ellis forced turnover, led to Santos transition three giving Rivals a 4-point lead.
Long contested back-to-back shots, kept Kings scoreless during decisive stretch.
Bench unit conceded 7-0 run prompting timeout and rotation shift.
events.impact: Highlighted depth concerns; future rotation tweak needed.

metrics.notes: Turnover rate under 11% for third straight game; half-court sets produced 1.08 PPP.
